title.narrative: 2.1: EARLY CHILDHOOD DEVELOPMENT

description.narrative: National and sub-national government have increased capacities for planning, budgeting, implementing and monitoring integrated quality early childhood development services with a focus on the most vulnerable children, which contributes to Early Childhood Development, Early Childhood Development (Covid), Early Learning, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning Outcomes, Learning Outcomes (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls and boys, in particular the most marginalized, are provided with inclusive and equitable quality education, developmental and learning opportunities in safe and secure learning environments

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National and sub-national government have increased capacities for planning, budgeting, implementing and monitoring integratedquality early childhood development services with a focus on the most vulnerable children

description.narrative: Early childhood development (ECD) has already been established as a core intervention for the country's development and future capabilities under the National Development Plan (NDP), confirming that South Africa will “make ECD a top priority among the measures to improve the quality of education and long-term prospects of future generations”. Evident in a solid policy environment; the Presidential direction that the function of ECD be fully embedded as a sub-sector of the country's education system. Notwithstanding significant progress, quality remains a persistent challenge, largely due to a poorly qualified workforce, lack of appropriate early learning approaches and inadequate resourcing. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:16/01/2020
